properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 4:19AM MST until January 13 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...PROLONGED AND PERSISTENT MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW OVER THE
SIERRA MADRE RANGE THIS WEEKEND...

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 21 to
24 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Sierra Madre Range.

* WHEN...From Saturday morning through late Sunday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy
blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could
cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Outdoor recreationists including
snowmobilers and hikers could become disoriented and lost in
very low visibility and heavy snowfall.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT
